STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 25, 2025
Jennifer Vasilovski
Family & Community Services- Livingston
3075 E. Grand River Ave.
Howell, MI, 48843-6584
RE: License#: CB470382419
Dear Ms. Vasilovski:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 4/24/25. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation
(4) An agency shall document placement specifications
consistent with the information contained in the
reevaluation. The placement specifications must
include all the following:
(a) The age, number, SOGIE, race, ethnic background,
and characteristics of children preferred by the
applicants.
Three of six foster home licensing reevaluations did not document placement
specifications regarding SOGIE.
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a
written adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the family
signing an adoption application and prior to approving a
family for adoption.
Three of three adoption evaluations were not completed within the required 90-
day time frame.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
4/12/23 Renewal, CAP approved 5/1/23.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical Assistance was not required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Parent/Agency Treatment Plan (PATP)- In a two-parent household, best
practice would be for both foster parents to sign the PATP to indicate it was
reviewed and provided to them.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency Interim inspection was completed on 4/1/24, with a CAP approved on
4/23/24. The agency was cited regarding foster parent training and licensing
application request. The agency has shown improvement in both areas, as there
were no repeat violations found during the current review. In 2023, the agency
was cited regarding timely completion of adoption evaluations. This continues to
be an area in need of improvement, as this was a repeat violation for 2025. The
agency will need to establish a new corrective action plan to address the repeat
violation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment dated 4/1/25 was reviewed. The agency
reported improved rule compliance over the past year by implementing monthly
supervisory audits of case files, a quarterly case service plan checklist, use of the
Book of Business, and spreadsheet trackers. The agency did not identify any
systemic barriers to compliance. The agency identified additional improvement is
needed regarding periodic medicals and dentals, and parent child visits. The
agency reported several unplanned moves due to one AWOL, the death of a
caregiver, three allegations in placement, and one foster parent request.

Financial Overview
The agency's 2023 financial audit, 2024 and 2025 budget were reviewed. The
2024 financial audit is currently in progress. No financial concerns were noted.
Staff Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on-site. Both staff reported they enjoy their roles with
the agency and the work environment is very positive. Both staff stated their
supervisors are knowledgeable, helpful, and supportive. Neither staff had any
concerns or suggestions for improvement at the agency.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in the same office building as previous years.
The building has adequate space for staff to complete their work and hold
meetings or trainings. There is sufficient space for clients to visit and secure
storage for files and confidential information.
VII. AGENCY ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
_ ___________April 24, 2025_________________________
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
April 25, 2025
_____________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
